title: NDTV News-World-news
description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

entries.title: Israel Hits Gaza Refugee Camp After School Strike As War Enters 9th Month
entries.description: Israeli strikes hammered a Gaza refugee camp on Friday after a deadly strike on a UN-run school, as the war sparked by Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel entered its ninth month.

entries.title: UK PM Rishi Sunak Leaves D-Day Ceremony Early For Interview, Apologises
entries.description: UK Leader Rishi Sunak apologised on Friday for leaving D-Day anniversary commemorations in northern France early to conduct a television interview during Britain's general election campaign.

entries.title: Olympic Rings On Eiffel Tower Unveiled Ahead Of Paris 2024 Games
entries.description: Paris 2024 organisers on Friday unveiled a display of the Olympic rings on the Eiffel Tower with 50 days to go until the Summer Olympics in the French capital.

entries.title: Indian Student Was On Video Call With Family Just Before Drowning In Russia
entries.description: Jishan Ashpak Pinjari, one of the four Indian students who drowned in the Volkhov river in Russia, was on a video call with parents when he and the three others drowned in the river, a family member said today.

entries.title: Samsung Workers' Go On 1st Strike In South Korea Over Paid Leaves
entries.description: Workers at tech giant Samsung Electronics in South Korea staged the first strike at the company on Friday, the head of a major union representing tens of thousands of people told AFP.

entries.title: More Landslides Likely In Papua New Guinea After 2,000 Killed Last Month
entries.description: Further landslides will likely plague the area where part of a mountain collapsed onto a remote village in Papua New Guinea two weeks ago, New Zealand geological experts warned on Friday, as authorities ended search and rescue efforts.

entries.title: For Chief Justice's Speech, UK Top Court President Offers His Seat
entries.description: In a special gesture for Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud, the President of the UK Supreme Court on Thursday offered him his seat for his address.

entries.title: All You Need To Know About The European Parliament Elections
entries.description: Around 373 million citizens across the 27 member states of the European Union are eligible to vote on June 6-9 in elections to the European Parliament.

entries.title: Counter Strike Video-Game Gun Accessory Sells For Over $1 Million
entries.description: A digital accessory for a video-game gun sold for more than $1 million on Wednesday, according to the brokers, marking one of the biggest such purchases ever.

entries.title: Ukraine Blocks Major Russian Assault: 5 Missiles, 48 Drones Downed
entries.description: Ukrainian air force shot down all five missiles and 48 out of 53 drones over nine regions during Russia's overnight attack, Ukrainian military said on Friday.

entries.title: YouTuber Arrested For Making Helicopter Shoot Fireworks At Lamborghini
entries.description: A YouTuber who allegedly directed a helicopter to shoot fireworks at a speeding Lamborghini for a "crazy stupid" video has been arrested in California, US prosecutors said Thursday.

entries.title: Elon Musk's Starship Does A Splashdown In The Sea: What It Means
entries.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX has achieved a remarkable feat with the successful splashdown of its Starship rocket system. This was the vehicle's fourth test flight and its first controlled return and soft ocean landing.

entries.title: Donald Trump To Announce His VP Soon, But His Shortlist Is Nearly All Men
entries.description: When the topic of Donald Trump's potential running mate arose at a Manhattan fundraiser last week, the Republican presidential candidate gave high marks to contenders including North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum and U.S. Senator Tim Scott.

entries.title: French Artist Ben, 88, Dies By Suicide After His Wife's Death
entries.description: Renowned French artist Ben has died at the age of 88, taking his own life shortly after the tragic loss of his beloved wife, CNN reported, citing his family's statement.

entries.title: UN Chief Condems Myanmar Military's Deadly Attack On Rohingya Civilians
entries.description: UN chief Antonio Guterres condemned on Thursday recent attacks by Myanmar's military that reportedly killed scores of civilians in western Rakhine state.

entries.title: Canadian Police Bust Migrant Smuggling Ring Sneaking People Into US
entries.description: Canadian police announced Thursday the dismantling of a vast migrant smuggling network accused of sneaking hundreds of people from Canada into the United States.

entries.title: UK Doctor Who Popularised Intermittent Fasting Goes Missing On Greek Island
entries.description: The doctor is credited for the rising popularity of the 5:2 diet for losing weight, which involves fasting for two days per week.

entries.title: Explosion Reported Near UK Merchant Vessel In Red Sea Off Yemen
entries.description: A merchant vessel reported an explosion took place near it in the Red Sea on Thursday about 19 nautical miles west of the Yemeni port city of Mokha, British security firm Ambrey said.

entries.title: Man Behind Dress ''That Broke The Internet'' Jailed For Strangling His Wife
entries.description: The attack came seven years after the couple gained worldwide fame for the dress the mother of the bride wore at their wedding.

entries.title: Second Japanese Town To Build Fence Around Bridge To Block Mount Fuji View
entries.description: The scenic bridge in Shizuoka prefecture aligns directly with the outline of Mount Fuji and has become a social media hotspot in recent months.
